definition: ending up as/leading to/resulting in/in total
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: The sun rises late and set early.
I never intellection I'd be here.
sentences.chinese: 我从未想过自己会落得如此地步。

sentences.english: Furry ropes of poison sumac veined across the ground.
sentences.chinese: 毒漆树毛茸茸的藤条落得满地都是。

sentences.english: The days are short and the nights are long. The sun rises late and sets early.
sentences.chinese: 因为此时白天短而夜晚长，太阳升得迟而落得早。

sentences.english: Anyone who drinks beer too much is bound to get a bay window.
sentences.chinese: 喝啤酒太多的人，必然会落得一个大肚皮。

sentences.english: If she wishes to insinuate go-between of " meaning " , get disappointment however and answer.
sentences.chinese: 她如愿巴结“意”中人，却落得失望而回。

sentences.english: But Realmadrid one time counter-attacks successfully, we only end up to turn out to be penniless.
sentences.chinese: 可皇马一次反击成功，我们只落得个两手空空。

sentences.english: The days are long and the nights are short. The sun rises early and the sets late.
sentences.chinese: 由于此时白天短而夜晚长，太阳升得迟而落得早。

sentences.english: And makest fair reputation but a bawd.
sentences.chinese: 使美誉落得跟娼妓一样。

sentences.english: The sun rises early and sets late.
She got a reputation as a frump.
sentences.chinese: 她落得了个邋遢女人的名声。

sentences.english: Otherwise you could end up frying your modem and possibly the motherboard too.
sentences.chinese: 否则，你可能落得油炸你的主机板调制解调器和可能。

sentences.english: Two of her girls had been on the point of marriage, and after all there was nothing in it.
sentences.chinese: 两个女儿本来快要出嫁了，到头来只落得一场空。

sentences.english: If you don't take my advice, you will end up behind bars.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不听我的劝告，最后总要落得坐班房的下场。

sentences.english: And what did I do to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我究竟做了什么要落得如此境地？

definition: in the end/finally/as a result
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
lamentable/sad(ly)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to degenerate/impoverished/to fall (into poverty)/to be reduced (to begging)
the chicken has flown the coop and the eggs are broken/a dead loss (idiom)
the end/to conclude
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
to be decapitated (idiom)
the end/an ending/to wind down/to conclude
plaintive/mournful/miserable
see 自食惡果|自食恶果[zi4 shi2 e4 guo3]
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
